intro: Uralepis pungens, commonly known as the spiked urare, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky bracts that enclose its small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Uralepis pungens is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
